requirements.title: FILE NAMES ON ARCHITECTURE FLOWCHART
requirements.description: Are all file names (e.g., renderComtradeCharts.js, chartComponent.js, createState.js, etc.) displayed in all flowchart nodes?

issues_found.issue: Inconsistent file name display across diagrams
issues_found.details: Some nodes display full filenames while others do not. Many nodes contain filenames in flowchart text but not all diagrams are consistent.
examples: Section 1: 'comtradeUtils.js(Parsing)' - file name shown with role
Section 1: 'createState.js(State)' - file name shown with role
Section 3: 'chartManager.js' referenced but not all state nodes show file names
Section 6: Node names like 'autoUnitScalePlugin' missing explicit '.js' suffix

nodes_needing_work.issue: All nodes reference chartComponent.js or renderComtradeCharts.js in text, but not consistently in node labels
Multiple nodes reference chartManager.js but file name not always in node label itself
File references scattered: Tooltip.js, handleVerticalLineShortcuts.js, setupChartDragAndDrop.js, createState.js - but not all in node labels
Plugin names lack '.js' extension in node labels, only have function descriptions

recommendations_for_fixes: Add file names to ALL plugin nodes: 'autoUnitScalePlugin()\nchartComponent.js'
Update Section 3 state nodes to include file reference where applicable
Standardize format: 'FunctionName\nfileName.js' for all nodes
Add file names to HISTORY, STATE, TRACK, PERSIST nodes in Section 6
Ensure every node has either a file reference or module path for clarity

requirements.title: NAVIGATIONS FOR JSDoc
requirements.description: Do all nodes have JSDoc navigation entries in jsDocMap? Check that every visible node in all 7 diagrams has a corresponding mapping.

issues_found.issue: Missing jsDocMap entries for several visible nodes
issues_found.details: Some diagram nodes do not have corresponding entries in jsDocMap, making them non-clickable

missing_nodes.note: Duplicate - also maps 'OPEN_WINDOW' but not all node IDs used in Section 7
Has mapping but may be confused with ROUTE in Section 2

issues_found.issue: Sequence diagram participants may not all be mapped
issues_found.details: Sections 1 and 5 use sequence diagrams with participants - not all participant names are unique JSDocMap keys
examples: Section 1: 'FileSystem' mapped, but also used as 'File System' text

nodes_missing_mappings: Subgraph identifiers: FILE_LOADING, STATE_INIT, CHART_RENDER, REACTIVE_SYS, EDITOR
Section 1 participants: User, FileSystem (partially), Interpolation (as state name)
Section 5 participants: User, Tabulator, Parent (partially as PARENT_HDL), Child (partially as variables)
Flow indicators and decision nodes that may be extracted as text nodes
recommendations_for_fixes: Add jsDocMap entries for all subgraph labels: FILE_LOADING, STATE_INIT, CHART_RENDER, REACTIVE_SYS, EDITOR
Map sequence diagram participants explicitly: ensure 'FileSystem', 'Utils', 'StateManager', 'Renderer', 'Display' work correctly
Add mappings for: Tabulator (as third-party), Interpolation (as process/module)
Create entries for all decision nodes and terminal states that appear as extracted text
Verify node ID extraction in extractNodeId() function handles all Mermaid diagram types

requirements.title: OBJECTS AND FUNCTION CALLS() NAME SHOULD BE ITALIC
requirements.description: Is the CSS rule `.mermaid svg g.clickable-node text { font-style: italic; }` present and are all function names suffixed with ()? Check consistency.

issues_found.issue: Inconsistent use of () suffix on function names in jsDocMap 'name' field
issues_found.details: Some function names have () suffix, others don't. This affects both visual consistency and semantic clarity.

functions_without_parentheses_found.name: Channel Type Router
functions_without_parentheses_found.should_be: routeChannelType() - currently is a decision node, not a function call

functions_without_parentheses_found.name: Add Plugins
functions_without_parentheses_found.issue: Generic, should reference specific plugin functions

functions_without_parentheses_found.name: Add Digital Plugins
functions_without_parentheses_found.issue: Generic, should reference specific plugin functions

functions_without_parentheses_found.name: Change Detection
functions_without_parentheses_found.issue: Process description, not a function call

functions_without_parentheses_found.name: Mouse Events
functions_without_parentheses_found.issue: Event handler group, not a single function

functions_without_parentheses_found.name: Keyboard Events
functions_without_parentheses_found.issue: Event handler group, not a single function

recommendations_for_fixes: Standardize naming: Functions/methods should always have () suffix in jsDocMap 'name' field
Objects/state variables should NOT have () suffix
Update all non-function processes to clearly indicate they are states, decisions, or processes
Create separate 'type' field in jsDocMap entries: 'function', 'object', 'state', 'process', 'decision'
CSS is correctly applied to .clickable-node - ensure all mapped entries get the clickable-node class

requirements.title: COMMA AFTER EVERY OBJECT
requirements.description: In node labels/descriptions, should there be commas after object property names? Check current format and identify where commas are missing.
requirements.analysis_notes: This requirement is unclear in implementation. Reviewing the file, node labels do use commas in some contexts but the requirement seems to ask for consistent comma usage after object/property names in descriptions.

current_patterns.example:
Extract metadata
- Channel Definitions
- Sampling Rates
- Time Multiplier

parseCFG()
Extract channel metadata
sampling rates and time data

issues_found.issue: Inconsistent comma usage in node descriptions
issues_found.details: Some nodes use commas between items, others use line breaks or dashes

specific_cases.current:
Extract Metadata
- Channel Definitions
- Sampling Rates
- Time Multiplier
specific_cases.suggested_format_with_commas:
Extract Metadata:
Channel Definitions, Sampling Rates, Time Multiplier

nodes_missing_commas: Section 1: parseCFG node (uses bullet points instead of comma-separated)
Section 1: parseDAT node (uses bullet points instead of comma-separated)
Section 1: Note over Utils (uses bullet points)
Section 7: CFG_OBJ (uses line breaks: 'analogChannels array, digitalChannels array, samplingRates')
Section 7: DATA_OBJ (uses line breaks: 'time float array, analogData 2D array, digitalData 2D array')
recommendations_for_fixes: Define clear style guide: properties should be comma-separated on same line when possible
Use line breaks only for major groupings or when comma list becomes too long
Update bullet point lists to use comma-separated format for consistency

Example standardization: Instead of '- Item1
- Item2
- Item3' use 'Item1, Item2, Item3'
For very long lists, consider grouping with semicolons or numbered points within the diagram

requirements.title: INTERNAL NAVIGATION FOR ALL FLOWCHARTS
requirements.description: Are all nodes in all 7 diagrams (sequence, flowchart, state, etc.) mapped in jsDocMap for clickable navigation?

unmapped_or_missing: Subgraph headers: FILE_LOADING, STATE_INIT, CHART_RENDER, REACTIVE_SYS, EDITOR
ROUTE decision node (appears twice - unclear if should be separate)
Flow connections that may be extracted as text

issues_found.details: Five subgraph layer labels are not in jsDocMap, making large sections non-clickable

issues_found.issue: Node ID extraction logic may miss some diagram elements
issues_found.details: extractNodeId() function has multiple fallback methods but may not catch all node types consistently across different Mermaid diagram types
affected_areas: Inline decision nodes with complex text

issues_found.details: Same ID used in multiple sections (e.g., 'AUTO', 'END', 'START') - may cause confusion in extraction

recommendations_for_fixes: Add ALL five subgraph identifiers to jsDocMap: FILE_LOADING, STATE_INIT, CHART_RENDER, REACTIVE_SYS, EDITOR
For duplicate IDs, modify Mermaid diagram syntax to use unique IDs (e.g., AUTO_S2, AUTO_S6 internally but keep same display label)
Improve extractNodeId() to handle subgraph labels: add pattern matching for 'subgraph' elements
Add explicit ID attributes in Mermaid syntax to ensure reliable extraction
Test node detection with browser console logging to verify all clickable nodes are properly mapped
Consider adding summary section showing coverage percentage and any missing nodes

requirements.title: SYNC CHANGES SHOULD BE MORE CLEAR
requirements.description: Is the 'Sync Changes' flow clear enough? Should it show more detail about what gets synced, where, and how?

issues_found.details: The node shows that changes are synced across charts but does not explain HOW synchronization occurs or WHAT specifically gets synced
missing_information: What properties are synchronized? (scales, labels, colors, data, etc.)
Which charts get updated? (all charts, only affected charts, etc.)
What methods are called? (setSeries, setLabel, forceRedraw, etc.)
What's the order of operations? (parallel, sequential, priority-based)
Are there dependencies between sync operations?

issues_found.issue: No detailed workflow showing sync mechanism
issues_found.details: Section 3 (Reactive State) shows state changes trigger sync, but doesn't show the detailed sync process
issues_found.gap: Transition from 'Sync' node to 'NotifySubscribers' -> 'UIUpdated' is too abstract

issues_found.issue: Section 7 doesn't show sync flow between LISTEN and COLOR_UPD/FULL_REC
issues_found.details: The complete architecture diagram doesn't clearly show the synchronization logic that follows state detection

issues_found.issue: No mention of sync strategy differences
issues_found.details: Doesn't explain in-place sync vs. full rebuild sync vs. partial rebuild
issues_found.missing_context: When is requestScaleSyncAndRedraw() called vs. setSeries() vs. forceRedraw()?

recommendations_for_fixes.details: Show explicit steps: Detect Change -> Determine Type -> Route to Handler -> Apply Updates -> Redraw Charts
recommendations_for_fixes.suggested_placement: Insert between Section 3 and Section 4, or as expansion of Section 3

recommendations_for_fixes.suggested:
Sync Changes
- Update Scales
- Update Labels
- Force Redraw
All Charts

recommendations_for_fixes.details: Show three sync paths: 1) In-Place (setSeries), 2) Partial (setLabel/setColor), 3) Full (destroy + recreate)
recommendations_for_fixes.should_show: When each method is used and which operations trigger each

recommendations_for_fixes.details: Expand the LISTEN node to branch into three sync strategies with explicit node types and operations
recommendations_for_fixes.example: LISTEN -> {COLOR_SYNC, SCALE_SYNC, DATA_SYNC} -> Apply Updates -> Redraw

recommendations_for_fixes.text: Sync Strategy: In-place updates (colors, labels) use setSeries/setLabel. Full rebuilds (grouping, scaling) recreate charts. Scale changes sync across all charts via requestScaleSync().
recommendations_for_fixes.location: End of document or as info box

recommendations_for_fixes.action: Link to detailed sync logic in chartManager.js
recommendations_for_fixes.details: jsDocMap entry for 'Sync' should reference chartManager.js specific sync logic implementation

key_action_items: 1. Add file names to all remaining nodes (especially Section 6 plugins)
2. Map all subgraph identifiers in Section 7 to jsDocMap
4. Standardize function naming with () and object naming without ()
5. Verify and fix node ID extraction in extractNodeId() function
